meanings.definition: To extract an excessive amount of milk from (a cow)
meanings.sent1: The farmer should not overmilk the cow, as it can be harmful.
meanings.sent2: She decided to overmilk the cow to get more milk for the cheese.
meanings.sent3: The cow rolled its eyes as the farmer tried to overmilk it for the third time that day.
meanings.sent4: Trying to overmilk the cow is like trying to squeeze water from a stone.
meanings.sent5: The image of the farmer trying to overmilk the cow stuck in my mind.

meanings.definition: To exploit or take advantage of (a situation) to an excessive degree
meanings.sent1: It is not right to overmilk a situation for personal gain.
meanings.sent2: He tends to overmilk any opportunity that comes his way.
meanings.sent3: She always finds a way to overmilk a situation and make it all about her.
meanings.sent4: Some people have a talent for overmilking every situation until it loses its value.
meanings.sent5: The politician's attempt to overmilk the crisis was met with public outrage.

meanings.definition: To overemphasize or dwell on (a topic) excessively
meanings.sent1: Try not to overmilk that point in your presentation.
meanings.sent2: The teacher tends to overmilk the importance of grammar in every lesson.
meanings.sent3: He always manages to overmilk the same old story whenever we meet.
meanings.sent4: She tends to overmilk her achievements, making others feel inadequate.
meanings.sent5: The author's tendency to overmilk the theme made the book tedious to read.
